206 | | assertApproxEqRel(a, b, maxPercentDelta); 207 | | } 208 | | } 209 | | } 210 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2; 5 | | 6 | | import "./StdStorage.sol"; 7 | | import "./Vm.sol"; 8 | | 9 | | abstract contract StdCheatsSafe { 10 | | VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))))); 11 | | 12 | | /// @dev To hide constructor warnings across solc versions due to different constructor visibility requirements and 13 | | /// syntaxes, we put the constructor in a private method and assign an unused return value to a variable. This 14 | | /// forces the method to run during construction, but without declaring an explicit constructor. 15 | | uint256 private CONSTRUCTOR = _constructor(); 16 | | 17 | | struct Chain { 18 | | // The chain name, using underscores as the separator to match `foundry.toml` conventions. 19 | | string name; 20 | | // The chain's Chain ID. 21 | | uint256 chainId; 22 | | // A default RPC endpoint for this chain. 23 | | // NOTE: This default RPC URL is included for convenience to facilitate quick tests and 24 | | // experimentation. Do not use this RPC URL for production test suites, CI, or other heavy 25 | | // usage as you will be throttled and this is a disservice to others who need this endpoint. 26 | | string rpcUrl; 27 | | } 28 | | 29 | | // Maps from a chain's name (matching what's in the `foundry.toml` file) to chain data. 30 | | mapping(string => Chain) internal stdChains; 31 | | 32 | | // Data structures to parse Transaction objects from the broadcast artifact 33 | | // that conform to EIP1559. The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON 34 | | // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX. 35 | | 36 | | struct RawTx1559 { 37 | | string[] arguments; 38 | | address contractAddress; 39 | | string contractName; 40 | | // json value name = function 41 | | string functionSig; 42 | | bytes32 hash; 43 | | // json value name = tx 44 | | RawTx1559Detail txDetail; 45 | | // json value name = type 46 | | string opcode; 47 | | } 48 | | 49 | | struct RawTx1559Detail { 50 | | AccessList[] accessList; 51 | | bytes data; 52 | | address from; 53 | | bytes gas; 54 | | bytes nonce; 55 | | address to; 56 | | bytes txType; 57 | | bytes value; 58 | | } 59 | | 60 | | struct Tx1559 { 61 | | string[] arguments; 62 | | address contractAddress; 63 | | string contractName; 64 | | string functionSig; 65 | | bytes32 hash; 66 | | Tx1559Detail txDetail; 67 | | string opcode; 68 | | } 69 | | 70 | | struct Tx1559Detail { 71 | | AccessList[] accessList; 72 | | bytes data; 73 | | address from; 74 | | uint256 gas; 75 | | uint256 nonce; 76 | | address to; 77 | | uint256 txType; 78 | | uint256 value; 79 | | } 80 | | 81 | | // Data structures to parse Transaction objects from the broadcast artifact 82 | | // that DO NOT conform to EIP1559. The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON 83 | | // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX. 84 | | 85 | | struct TxLegacy { 86 | | string[] arguments; 87 | | address contractAddress; 88 | | string contractName; 89 | | string functionSig; 90 | | string hash; 91 | | string opcode; 92 | | TxDetailLegacy transaction; 93 | | } 94 | | 95 | | struct TxDetailLegacy { 96 | | AccessList[] accessList; 97 | | uint256 chainId; 98 | | bytes data; 99 | | address from; 100 | | uint256 gas; 101 | | uint256 gasPrice; 102 | | bytes32 hash; 103 | | uint256 nonce; 104 | | bytes1 opcode; 105 | | bytes32 r; 106 | | bytes32 s; 107 | | uint256 txType; 108 | | address to; 109 | | uint8 v; 110 | | uint256 value; 111 | | } 112 | | 113 | | struct AccessList { 114 | | address accessAddress; 115 | | bytes32[] storageKeys; 116 | | } 117 | | 118 | | // Data structures to parse Receipt objects from the broadcast artifact. 119 | | // The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON 120 | | // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX. 121 | | 122 | | struct RawReceipt { 123 | | bytes32 blockHash; 124 | | bytes blockNumber; 125 | | address contractAddress; 126 | | bytes cumulativeGasUsed; 127 | | bytes effectiveGasPrice; 128 | | address from; 129 | | bytes gasUsed; 130 | | RawReceiptLog[] logs; 131 | | bytes logsBloom; 132 | | bytes status; 133 | | address to; 134 | | bytes32 transactionHash; 135 | | bytes transactionIndex; 136 | | } 137 | | 138 | | struct Receipt { 139 | | bytes32 blockHash; 140 | | uint256 blockNumber; 141 | | address contractAddress; 142 | | uint256 cumulativeGasUsed; 143 | | uint256 effectiveGasPrice; 144 | | address from; 145 | | uint256 gasUsed; 146 | | ReceiptLog[] logs; 147 | | bytes logsBloom; 148 | | uint256 status; 149 | | address to; 150 | | bytes32 transactionHash; 151 | | uint256 transactionIndex; 152 | | } 153 | | 154 | | // Data structures to parse the entire broadcast artifact, assuming the 155 | | // transactions conform to EIP1559. 156 | | 157 | | struct EIP1559ScriptArtifact { 158 | | string[] libraries; 159 | | string path; 160 | | string[] pending; 161 | | Receipt[] receipts; 162 | | uint256 timestamp; 163 | | Tx1559[] transactions; 164 | | TxReturn[] txReturns; 165 | | } 166 | | 167 | | struct RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact { 168 | | string[] libraries; 169 | | string path; 170 | | string[] pending; 171 | | RawReceipt[] receipts; 172 | | TxReturn[] txReturns; 173 | | uint256 timestamp; 174 | | RawTx1559[] transactions; 175 | | } 176 | | 177 | | struct RawReceiptLog { 178 | | // json value = address 179 | | address logAddress; 180 | | bytes32 blockHash; 181 | | bytes blockNumber; 182 | | bytes data; 183 | | bytes logIndex; 184 | | bool removed; 185 | | bytes32[] topics; 186 | | bytes32 transactionHash; 187 | | bytes transactionIndex; 188 | | bytes transactionLogIndex; 189 | | } 190 | | 191 | | struct ReceiptLog { 192 | | // json value = address 193 | | address logAddress; 194 | | bytes32 blockHash; 195 | | uint256 blockNumber; 196 | | bytes data; 197 | | uint256 logIndex; 198 | | bytes32[] topics; 199 | | uint256 transactionIndex; 200 | | uint256 transactionLogIndex; 201 | | bool removed; 202 | | } 203 | | 204 | | struct TxReturn { 205 | | string internalType; 206 | | string value; 207 | | } 208 | | 209 | | function _constructor() private returns (uint256) { 210 | | // Initialize `stdChains` with the defaults. 211 | | stdChains["anvil"] = Chain("Anvil", 31337, "http://127.0.0.1:8545"); 212 | | stdChains["hardhat"] = Chain("Hardhat", 31337, "http://127.0.0.1:8545"); 213 | | stdChains["mainnet"] = Chain("Mainnet", 1, "https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/6770454bc6ea42c58aac12978531b93f"); 214 | | stdChains["goerli"] = Chain("Goerli", 5, "https://goerli.infura.io/v3/6770454bc6ea42c58aac12978531b93f"); 215 | | stdChains["sepolia"] = Chain("Sepolia", 11155111, "https://rpc.sepolia.dev"); 216 | | stdChains["optimism"] = Chain("Optimism", 10, "https://mainnet.optimism.io"); 217 | | stdChains["optimism_goerli"] = Chain("Optimism Goerli", 420, "https://goerli.optimism.io"); 218 | | stdChains["arbitrum_one"] = Chain("Arbitrum One", 42161, "https://arb1.arbitrum.io/rpc"); 219 | | stdChains["arbitrum_one_goerli"] = Chain("Arbitrum One Goerli", 421613, "https://goerli-rollup.arbitrum.io/rpc"); 220 | | stdChains["arbitrum_nova"] = Chain("Arbitrum Nova", 42170, "https://nova.arbitrum.io/rpc"); 221 | | stdChains["polygon"] = Chain("Polygon", 137, "https://polygon-rpc.com"); 222 | | stdChains["polygon_mumbai"] = Chain("Polygon Mumbai", 80001, "https://rpc-mumbai.matic.today"); 223 | | stdChains["avalanche"] = Chain("Avalanche", 43114, "https://api.avax.network/ext/bc/C/rpc"); 224 | | stdChains["avalanche_fuji"] = Chain("Avalanche Fuji", 43113, "https://api.avax-test.network/ext/bc/C/rpc"); 225 | | stdChains["bnb_smart_chain"] = Chain("BNB Smart Chain", 56, "https://bsc-dataseed1.binance.org"); 226 | | stdChains["bnb_smart_chain_testnet"] = Chain("BNB Smart Chain Testnet", 97, "https://data-seed-prebsc-1-s1.binance.org:8545");// forgefmt: disable-line 227 | | stdChains["gnosis_chain"] = Chain("Gnosis Chain", 100, "https://rpc.gnosischain.com"); 228 | | 229 | | // Loop over RPC URLs in the config file to replace the default RPC URLs 230 | | Vm.Rpc[] memory rpcs = vm.rpcUrlStructs(); 231 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < rpcs.length; i++) { 232 | | stdChains[rpcs[i].name].rpcUrl = rpcs[i].url; 233 | | } 234 | | return 0; 235 | | } 236 | | 237 | | function assumeNoPrecompiles(address addr) internal view virtual { 238 | | // Assembly required since `block.chainid` was introduced in 0.8.0. 239 | | uint256 chainId; 240 | | assembly { 241 | | chainId := chainid() 242 | | } 243 | | assumeNoPrecompiles(addr, chainId); 244 | | } 245 | | 246 | | function assumeNoPrecompiles(address addr, uint256 chainId) internal view virtual { 247 | | // Note: For some chains like Optimism these are technically predeploys (i.e. bytecode placed at a specific 248 | | // address), but the same rationale for excluding them applies so we include those too. 249 | | 250 | | // These should be present on all EVM-compatible chains. 251 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x1) || addr > address(0x9)); 252 | | 253 | | // forgefmt: disable-start 254 | | if (chainId == stdChains["optimism"].chainId || chainId == stdChains["optimism_goerli"].chainId) { 255 | | // https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/eaa371a0184b56b7ca6d9eb9cb0a2b78b2ccd864/op-bindings/predeploys/addresses.go#L6-L21 256 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000800)); 257 | | } else if (chainId == stdChains["arbitrum_one"].chainId || chainId == stdChains["arbitrum_one_goerli"].chainId) { 258 | | // https://developer.arbitrum.io/useful-addresses#arbitrum-precompiles-l2-same-on-all-arb-chains 259 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000064) || addr > address(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000068)); 260 | | } else if (chainId == stdChains["avalanche"].chainId || chainId == stdChains["avalanche_fuji"].chainId) { 261 | | // https://github.com/ava-labs/subnet-evm/blob/47c03fd007ecaa6de2c52ea081596e0a88401f58/precompile/params.go#L18-L59 262 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x0100000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x01000000000000000000000000000000000000ff)); 263 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x0200000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x02000000000000000000000000000000000000FF)); 264 | | vm.assume(addr < address(0x0300000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x03000000000000000000000000000000000000Ff)); 265 | | } 266 | | // forgefmt: disable-end 267 | | } 268 | | 269 | | function readEIP1559ScriptArtifact(string memory path) 270 | | internal 271 | | view 272 | | virtual 273 | | returns (EIP1559ScriptArtifact memory) 274 | | { 275 | | string memory data = vm.readFile(path); 276 | | bytes memory parsedData = vm.parseJson(data); 277 | | RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact memory rawArtifact = abi.decode(parsedData, (RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact)); 278 | | EIP1559ScriptArtifact memory artifact; 279 | | artifact.libraries = rawArtifact.libraries; 280 | | artifact.path = rawArtifact.path; 281 | | artifact.timestamp = rawArtifact.timestamp; 282 | | artifact.pending = rawArtifact.pending; 283 | | artifact.txReturns = rawArtifact.txReturns; 284 | | artifact.receipts = rawToConvertedReceipts(rawArtifact.receipts); 285 | | artifact.transactions = rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(rawArtifact.transactions); 286 | | return artifact; 287 | | } 288 | | 289 | | function rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(RawTx1559[] memory rawTxs) internal pure virtual returns (Tx1559[] memory) { 290 | | Tx1559[] memory txs = new Tx1559[](rawTxs.length); 291 | | for (uint256 i; i < rawTxs.length; i++) { 292 | | txs[i] = rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(rawTxs[i]); 293 | | } 294 | | return txs; 295 | | } 296 | | 297 | | function rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(RawTx1559 memory rawTx) internal pure virtual returns (Tx1559 memory) { 298 | | Tx1559 memory transaction; 299 | | transaction.arguments = rawTx.arguments; 300 | | transaction.contractName = rawTx.contractName; 301 | | transaction.functionSig = rawTx.functionSig; 302 | | transaction.hash = rawTx.hash; 303 | | transaction.txDetail = rawToConvertedEIP1559Detail(rawTx.txDetail); 304 | | transaction.opcode = rawTx.opcode; 305 | | return transaction; 306 | | } 307 | | 308 | | function rawToConvertedEIP1559Detail(RawTx1559Detail memory rawDetail) 309 | | internal 310 | | pure 311 | | virtual 312 | | returns (Tx1559Detail memory) 313 | | { 314 | | Tx1559Detail memory txDetail; 315 | | txDetail.data = rawDetail.data; 316 | | txDetail.from = rawDetail.from; 317 | | txDetail.to = rawDetail.to; 318 | | txDetail.nonce = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.nonce); 319 | | txDetail.txType = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.txType); 320 | | txDetail.value = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.value); 321 | | txDetail.gas = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.gas); 322 | | txDetail.accessList = rawDetail.accessList; 323 | | return txDetail; 324 | | } 325 | | 326 | | function readTx1559s(string memory path) internal view virtual returns (Tx1559[] memory) { 327 | | string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path); 328 | | bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, ".transactions"); 329 | | RawTx1559[] memory rawTxs = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawTx1559[])); 330 | | return rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(rawTxs); 331 | | } 332 | | 333 | | function readTx1559(string memory path, uint256 index) internal view virtual returns (Tx1559 memory) { 334 | | string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path); 335 | | string memory key = string(abi.encodePacked(".transactions[", vm.toString(index), "]")); 336 | | bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, key); 337 | | RawTx1559 memory rawTx = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawTx1559)); 338 | | return rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(rawTx); 339 | | } 340 | | 341 | | // Analogous to readTransactions, but for receipts. 342 | | function readReceipts(string memory path) internal view virtual returns (Receipt[] memory) { 343 | | string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path); 344 | | bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, ".receipts"); 345 | | RawReceipt[] memory rawReceipts = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawReceipt[])); 346 | | return rawToConvertedReceipts(rawReceipts); 347 | | } 348 | | 349 | | function readReceipt(string memory path, uint256 index) internal view virtual returns (Receipt memory) { 350 | | string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path); 351 | | string memory key = string(abi.encodePacked(".receipts[", vm.toString(index), "]")); 352 | | bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, key); 353 | | RawReceipt memory rawReceipt = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawReceipt)); 354 | | return rawToConvertedReceipt(rawReceipt); 355 | | } 356 | | 357 | | function rawToConvertedReceipts(RawReceipt[] memory rawReceipts) internal pure virtual returns (Receipt[] memory) { 358 | | Receipt[] memory receipts = new Receipt[](rawReceipts.length); 359 | | for (uint256 i; i < rawReceipts.length; i++) { 360 | | receipts[i] = rawToConvertedReceipt(rawReceipts[i]); 361 | | } 362 | | return receipts; 363 | | } 364 | | 365 | | function rawToConvertedReceipt(RawReceipt memory rawReceipt) internal pure virtual returns (Receipt memory) { 366 | | Receipt memory receipt; 367 | | receipt.blockHash = rawReceipt.blockHash; 368 | | receipt.to = rawReceipt.to; 369 | | receipt.from = rawReceipt.from; 370 | | receipt.contractAddress = rawReceipt.contractAddress; 371 | | receipt.effectiveGasPrice = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.effectiveGasPrice); 372 | | receipt.cumulativeGasUsed = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.cumulativeGasUsed); 373 | | receipt.gasUsed = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.gasUsed); 374 | | receipt.status = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.status); 375 | | receipt.transactionIndex = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.transactionIndex); 376 | | receipt.blockNumber = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.blockNumber); 377 | | receipt.logs = rawToConvertedReceiptLogs(rawReceipt.logs); 378 | | receipt.logsBloom = rawReceipt.logsBloom; 379 | | receipt.transactionHash = rawReceipt.transactionHash; 380 | | return receipt; 381 | | } 382 | | 383 | | function rawToConvertedReceiptLogs(RawReceiptLog[] memory rawLogs) 384 | | internal 385 | | pure 386 | | virtual 387 | | returns (ReceiptLog[] memory) 388 | | { 389 | | ReceiptLog[] memory logs = new ReceiptLog[](rawLogs.length); 390 | | for (uint256 i; i < rawLogs.length; i++) { 391 | | logs[i].logAddress = rawLogs[i].logAddress; 392 | | logs[i].blockHash = rawLogs[i].blockHash; 393 | | logs[i].blockNumber = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].blockNumber); 394 | | logs[i].data = rawLogs[i].data; 395 | | logs[i].logIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].logIndex); 396 | | logs[i].topics = rawLogs[i].topics; 397 | | logs[i].transactionIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].transactionIndex); 398 | | logs[i].transactionLogIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].transactionLogIndex); 399 | | logs[i].removed = rawLogs[i].removed; 400 | | } 401 | | return logs; 402 | | } 403 | | 404 | | // Deploy a contract by fetching the contract bytecode from 405 | | // the artifacts directory 406 | | // e.g. `deployCode(code, abi.encode(arg1,arg2,arg3))` 407 | | function deployCode(string memory what, bytes memory args) internal virtual returns (address addr) { 408 | | bytes memory bytecode = abi.encodePacked(vm.getCode(what), args); 409 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 410 | | assembly { 411 | | addr := create(0, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode)) 412 | | } 413 | | 414 | | require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,bytes): Deployment failed."); 415 | | } 416 | | 417 | | function deployCode(string memory what) internal virtual returns (address addr) { 418 | | bytes memory bytecode = vm.getCode(what); 419 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 420 | | assembly { 421 | | addr := create(0, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode)) 422 | | } 423 | | 424 | | require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string): Deployment failed."); 425 | | } 426 | | 427 | | /// @dev deploy contract with value on construction 428 | | function deployCode(string memory what, bytes memory args, uint256 val) internal virtual returns (address addr) { 429 | | bytes memory bytecode = abi.encodePacked(vm.getCode(what), args); 430 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 431 | | assembly { 432 | | addr := create(val, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode)) 433 | | } 434 | | 435 | | require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,bytes,uint256): Deployment failed."); 436 | | } 437 | | 438 | | function deployCode(string memory what, uint256 val) internal virtual returns (address addr) { 439 | | bytes memory bytecode = vm.getCode(what); 440 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 441 | | assembly { 442 | | addr := create(val, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode)) 443 | | } 444 | | 445 | | require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,uint256): Deployment failed."); 446 | | } 447 | | 448 | | // creates a labeled address and the corresponding private key 449 | | function makeAddrAndKey(string memory name) internal virtual returns (address addr, uint256 privateKey) { 450 | | privateKey = uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(name))); 451 | | addr = vm.addr(privateKey); 452 | | vm.label(addr, name); 453 | | } 454 | | 455 | | // creates a labeled address 456 | | function makeAddr(string memory name) internal virtual returns (address addr) { 457 | | (addr,) = makeAddrAndKey(name); 458 | | } 459 | | 460 | | function deriveRememberKey(string memory mnemonic, uint32 index) 461 | | internal 462 | | virtual 463 | | returns (address who, uint256 privateKey) 464 | | { 465 | | privateKey = vm.deriveKey(mnemonic, index); 466 | | who = vm.rememberKey(privateKey); 467 | | } 468 | | 469 | | function _bytesToUint(bytes memory b) private pure returns (uint256) { 470 | | require(b.length <= 32, "StdCheats _bytesToUint(bytes): Bytes length exceeds 32."); 471 | | return abi.decode(abi.encodePacked(new bytes(32 - b.length), b), (uint256)); 472 | | } 473 | | } 474 | | 475 | | // Wrappers around cheatcodes to avoid footguns 476 | | abstract contract StdCheats is StdCheatsSafe { 477 | | using stdStorage for StdStorage; 478 | | 479 | | StdStorage private stdstore; 480 | | Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))))); 481 | | 482 | | // Skip forward or rewind time by the specified number of seconds 483 | | function skip(uint256 time) internal virtual { 484 | | vm.warp(block.timestamp + time); 485 | | } 486 | | 487 | | function rewind(uint256 time) internal virtual { 488 | | vm.warp(block.timestamp - time); 489 | | } 490 | | 491 | | // Setup a prank from an address that has some ether 492 | | function hoax(address who) internal virtual { 493 | | vm.deal(who, 1 << 128); 494 | | vm.prank(who); 495 | | } 496 | | 497 | | function hoax(address who, uint256 give) internal virtual { 498 | | vm.deal(who, give); 499 | | vm.prank(who); 500 | | } 501 | | 502 | | function hoax(address who, address origin) internal virtual { 503 | | vm.deal(who, 1 << 128); 504 | | vm.prank(who, origin); 505 | | } 506 | | 507 | | function hoax(address who, address origin, uint256 give) internal virtual { 508 | | vm.deal(who, give); 509 | | vm.prank(who, origin); 510 | | } 511 | | 512 | | // Start perpetual prank from an address that has some ether 513 | | function startHoax(address who) internal virtual { 514 | | vm.deal(who, 1 << 128); 515 | | vm.startPrank(who); 516 | | } 517 | | 518 | | function startHoax(address who, uint256 give) internal virtual { 519 | | vm.deal(who, give); 520 | | vm.startPrank(who); 521 | | } 522 | | 523 | | // Start perpetual prank from an address that has some ether 524 | | // tx.origin is set to the origin parameter 525 | | function startHoax(address who, address origin) internal virtual { 526 | | vm.deal(who, 1 << 128); 527 | | vm.startPrank(who, origin); 528 | | } 529 | | 530 | | function startHoax(address who, address origin, uint256 give) internal virtual { 531 | | vm.deal(who, give); 532 | | vm.startPrank(who, origin); 533 | | } 534 | | 535 | | function changePrank(address who) internal virtual { 536 | | vm.stopPrank(); 537 | | vm.startPrank(who); 538 | | } 539 | | 540 | | // The same as Vm's `deal` 541 | | // Use the alternative signature for ERC20 tokens 542 | | function deal(address to, uint256 give) internal virtual { 543 | | vm.deal(to, give); 544 | | } 545 | | 546 | | // Set the balance of an account for any ERC20 token 547 | | // Use the alternative signature to update `totalSupply` 548 | | function deal(address token, address to, uint256 give) internal virtual { 549 | | deal(token, to, give, false); 550 | | } 551 | | 552 | | function deal(address token, address to, uint256 give, bool adjust) internal virtual { 553 | | // get current balance 554 | | (, bytes memory balData) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x70a08231, to)); 555 | | uint256 prevBal = abi.decode(balData, (uint256)); 556 | | 557 | | // update balance 558 | | stdstore.target(token).sig(0x70a08231).with_key(to).checked_write(give); 559 | | 560 | | // update total supply 561 | | if (adjust) { 562 | | (, bytes memory totSupData) = token.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x18160ddd)); 563 | | uint256 totSup = abi.decode(totSupData, (uint256)); 564 | | if (give < prevBal) { 565 | | totSup -= (prevBal - give); 566 | | } else { 567 | | totSup += (give - prevBal); 568 | | } 569 | | stdstore.target(token).sig(0x18160ddd).checked_write(totSup); 570 | | } 571 | | } 572 | | } 573 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdError.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | // Panics work for versions >=0.8.0, but we lowered the pragma to make this compatible with Test 3 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 4 | | 5 | | library stdError { 6 | | bytes public constant assertionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x01); 7 | | bytes public constant arithmeticError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x11); 8 | | bytes public constant divisionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x12); 9 | | bytes public constant enumConversionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x21); 10 | | bytes public constant encodeStorageError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x22); 11 | | bytes public constant popError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x31); 12 | | bytes public constant indexOOBError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x32); 13 | | bytes public constant memOverflowError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x41); 14 | | bytes public constant zeroVarError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x51); 15 | | } 16 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.0 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2; 5 | | 6 | | import "./Vm.sol"; 7 | | 8 | | // Helpers for parsing and writing JSON files 9 | | // To parse: 10 | | // ``` 11 | | // using stdJson for string; 12 | | // string memory json = vm.readFile("some_peth"); 13 | | // json.parseUint("<json_path>"); 14 | | // ``` 15 | | // To write: 16 | | // ``` 17 | | // using stdJson for string; 18 | | // string memory json = "deploymentArtifact"; 19 | | // Contract contract = new Contract(); 20 | | // json.serialize("contractAddress", address(contract)); 21 | | // json = json.serialize("deploymentTimes", uint(1)); 22 | | // // store the stringified JSON to the 'json' variable we have been using as a key 23 | | // // as we won't need it any longer 24 | | // string memory json2 = "finalArtifact"; 25 | | // string memory final = json2.serialize("depArtifact", json); 26 | | // final.write("<some_path>"); 27 | | // ``` 28 | | 29 | | library stdJson { 30 | | VmSafe private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))))); /Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | library stdMath { 5 | | int256 private constant INT256_MIN = -57896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968; 6 | | 7 | | function abs(int256 a) internal pure returns (uint256) { 8 | | // Required or it will fail when `a = type(int256).min` 9 | | if (a == INT256_MIN) { 10 | | return 57896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968; 11 | | } 12 | | 13 | | return uint256(a > 0 ? a : -a); 14 | | } 15 | | 16 | | function delta(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) { 17 | | return a > b ? a - b : b - a; 18 | | } 19 | | 20 | | function delta(int256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) { 21 | | // a and b are of the same sign 22 | | // this works thanks to two's complement, the left-most bit is the sign bit 23 | | if ((a ^ b) > -1) { 24 | | return delta(abs(a), abs(b)); 25 | | } 26 | | 27 | | // a and b are of opposite signs 28 | | return abs(a) + abs(b); 29 | | } 30 | | 31 | | function percentDelta(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) { 32 | | uint256 absDelta = delta(a, b); 33 | | 34 | | return absDelta * 1e18 / b; 35 | | } 36 | | 37 | | function percentDelta(int256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) { 38 | | uint256 absDelta = delta(a, b); 39 | | uint256 absB = abs(b); 40 | | 41 | | return absDelta * 1e18 / absB; 42 | | } 43 | | } 44 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | import "./Vm.sol"; 5 | | 6 | | struct StdStorage { 7 | | mapping(address => mapping(bytes4 => mapping(bytes32 => uint256))) slots; 8 | | mapping(address => mapping(bytes4 => mapping(bytes32 => bool))) finds; 9 | | bytes32[] _keys; 10 | | bytes4 _sig; 11 | | uint256 _depth; 12 | | address _target; 13 | | bytes32 _set; 14 | | } 15 | | 16 | | library stdStorageSafe { 17 | | event SlotFound(address who, bytes4 fsig, bytes32 keysHash, uint256 slot); 18 | | event WARNING_UninitedSlot(address who, uint256 slot); 19 | | 20 | | Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))))); 21 | | 22 | | function sigs(string memory sigStr) internal pure returns (bytes4) { 23 | | return bytes4(keccak256(bytes(sigStr))); 24 | | } 25 | | 26 | | /// @notice find an arbitrary storage slot given a function sig, input data, address of the contract and a value to check against 27 | | // slot complexity: 28 | | // if flat, will be bytes32(uint256(uint)); 29 | | // if map, will be keccak256(abi.encode(key, uint(slot))); 30 | | // if deep map, will be keccak256(abi.encode(key1, keccak256(abi.encode(key0, uint(slot))))); 31 | | // if map struct, will be bytes32(uint256(keccak256(abi.encode(key1, keccak256(abi.encode(key0, uint(slot)))))) + structFieldDepth); 32 | | function find(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256) { 33 | | address who = self._target; 34 | | bytes4 fsig = self._sig; 35 | | uint256 field_depth = self._depth; 36 | | bytes32[] memory ins = self._keys; 37 | | 38 | | // calldata to test against 39 | | if (self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))]) { 40 | | return self.slots[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))]; 41 | | } 42 | | bytes memory cald = abi.encodePacked(fsig, flatten(ins)); 43 | | vm.record(); 44 | | bytes32 fdat; 45 | | { 46 | | (, bytes memory rdat) = who.staticcall(cald); 47 | | fdat = bytesToBytes32(rdat, 32 * field_depth); 48 | | } 49 | | 50 | | (bytes32[] memory reads,) = vm.accesses(address(who)); 51 | | if (reads.length == 1) { 52 | | bytes32 curr = vm.load(who, reads[0]); 53 | | if (curr == bytes32(0)) { 54 | | emit WARNING_UninitedSlot(who, uint256(reads[0])); 55 | | } 56 | | if (fdat != curr) { 57 | | require( 58 | | false, 59 | | "stdStorage find(StdStorage): Packed slot. This would cause dangerous overwriting and currently isn't supported." 60 | | ); 61 | | } 62 | | emit SlotFound(who, fsig, keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth)), uint256(reads[0])); 63 | | self.slots[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))] = uint256(reads[0]); 64 | | self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))] = true; 65 | | } else if (reads.length > 1) { 66 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < reads.length; i++) { 67 | | bytes32 prev = vm.load(who, reads[i]); 68 | | if (prev == bytes32(0)) { 69 | | emit WARNING_UninitedSlot(who, uint256(reads[i])); 70 | | } 71 | | // store 72 | | vm.store(who, reads[i], bytes32(hex"1337")); 73 | | bool success; 74 | | bytes memory rdat; 75 | | { 76 | | (success, rdat) = who.staticcall(cald); 77 | | fdat = bytesToBytes32(rdat, 32 * field_depth); 78 | | } 79 | | 80 | | if (success && fdat == bytes32(hex"1337")) { 81 | | // we found which of the slots is the actual one 82 | | emit SlotFound(who, fsig, keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth)), uint256(reads[i])); 83 | | self.slots[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))] = uint256(reads[i]); 84 | | self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))] = true; 85 | | vm.store(who, reads[i], prev); 86 | | break; 87 | | } 88 | | vm.store(who, reads[i], prev); 89 | | } 90 | | } else { 91 | | require(false, "stdStorage find(StdStorage): No storage use detected for target."); 92 | | } 93 | | 94 | | require( 95 | | self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))], 96 | | "stdStorage find(StdStorage): Slot(s) not found." 97 | | ); 98 | | 99 | | delete self._target; 100 | | delete self._sig; 101 | | delete self._keys; 102 | | delete self._depth; 103 | | 104 | | return self.slots[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))]; 105 | | } 106 | | 107 | | function target(StdStorage storage self, address _target) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 108 | | self._target = _target; 109 | | return self; 110 | | } 111 | | 112 | | function sig(StdStorage storage self, bytes4 _sig) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 113 | | self._sig = _sig; 114 | | return self; 115 | | } 116 | | 117 | | function sig(StdStorage storage self, string memory _sig) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 118 | | self._sig = sigs(_sig); 119 | | return self; 120 | | } 121 | | 122 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, address who) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 123 | | self._keys.push(bytes32(uint256(uint160(who)))); 124 | | return self; 125 | | } 126 | | 127 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, uint256 amt) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 128 | | self._keys.push(bytes32(amt)); 129 | | return self; 130 | | } 131 | | 132 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 key) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 133 | | self._keys.push(key); 134 | | return self; 135 | | } 136 | | 137 | | function depth(StdStorage storage self, uint256 _depth) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 138 | | self._depth = _depth; 139 | | return self; 140 | | } 141 | | 142 | | function read(StdStorage storage self) private returns (bytes memory) { 143 | | address t = self._target; 144 | | uint256 s = find(self); 145 | | return abi.encode(vm.load(t, bytes32(s))); 146 | | } 147 | | 148 | | function read_bytes32(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bytes32) { 149 | | return abi.decode(read(self), (bytes32)); 150 | | } 151 | | 152 | | function read_bool(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bool) { 153 | | int256 v = read_int(self); 154 | | if (v == 0) return false; 155 | | if (v == 1) return true; 156 | | revert("stdStorage read_bool(StdStorage): Cannot decode. Make sure you are reading a bool."); 157 | | } 158 | | 159 | | function read_address(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (address) { 160 | | return abi.decode(read(self), (address)); 161 | | } 162 | | 163 | | function read_uint(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256) { 164 | | return abi.decode(read(self), (uint256)); 165 | | } 166 | | 167 | | function read_int(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (int256) { 168 | | return abi.decode(read(self), (int256)); 169 | | } 170 | | 171 | | function bytesToBytes32(bytes memory b, uint256 offset) private pure returns (bytes32) { 172 | | bytes32 out; 173 | | 174 | | uint256 max = b.length > 32 ? 32 : b.length; 175 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < max; i++) { 176 | | out |= bytes32(b[offset + i] & 0xFF) >> (i * 8); 177 | | } 178 | | return out; 179 | | } 180 | | 181 | | function flatten(bytes32[] memory b) private pure returns (bytes memory) { 182 | | bytes memory result = new bytes(b.length * 32); 183 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < b.length; i++) { 184 | | bytes32 k = b[i]; 185 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 186 | | assembly { 187 | | mstore(add(result, add(32, mul(32, i))), k) 188 | | } 189 | | } 190 | | 191 | | return result; 192 | | } 193 | | } 194 | | 195 | | library stdStorage { 196 | | Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))))); 197 | | 198 | | function sigs(string memory sigStr) internal pure returns (bytes4) { 199 | | return stdStorageSafe.sigs(sigStr); 200 | | } 201 | | 202 | | function find(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256) { 203 | | return stdStorageSafe.find(self); 204 | | } 205 | | 206 | | function target(StdStorage storage self, address _target) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 207 | | return stdStorageSafe.target(self, _target); 208 | | } 209 | | 210 | | function sig(StdStorage storage self, bytes4 _sig) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 211 | | return stdStorageSafe.sig(self, _sig); 212 | | } 213 | | 214 | | function sig(StdStorage storage self, string memory _sig) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 215 | | return stdStorageSafe.sig(self, _sig); 216 | | } 217 | | 218 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, address who) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 219 | | return stdStorageSafe.with_key(self, who); 220 | | } 221 | | 222 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, uint256 amt) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 223 | | return stdStorageSafe.with_key(self, amt); 224 | | } 225 | | 226 | | function with_key(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 key) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 227 | | return stdStorageSafe.with_key(self, key); 228 | | } 229 | | 230 | | function depth(StdStorage storage self, uint256 _depth) internal returns (StdStorage storage) { 231 | | return stdStorageSafe.depth(self, _depth); 232 | | } 233 | | 234 | | function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, address who) internal { 235 | | checked_write(self, bytes32(uint256(uint160(who)))); 236 | | } 237 | | 238 | | function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, uint256 amt) internal { 239 | | checked_write(self, bytes32(amt)); 240 | | } 241 | | 242 | | function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, bool write) internal { 243 | | bytes32 t; 244 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 245 | | assembly { 246 | | t := write 247 | | } 248 | | checked_write(self, t); 249 | | } 250 | | 251 | | function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 set) internal { 252 | | address who = self._target; 253 | | bytes4 fsig = self._sig; 254 | | uint256 field_depth = self._depth; 255 | | bytes32[] memory ins = self._keys; 256 | | 257 | | bytes memory cald = abi.encodePacked(fsig, flatten(ins)); 258 | | if (!self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))]) { 259 | | find(self); 260 | | } 261 | | bytes32 slot = bytes32(self.slots[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(ins, field_depth))]); 262 | | 263 | | bytes32 fdat; 264 | | { 265 | | (, bytes memory rdat) = who.staticcall(cald); 266 | | fdat = bytesToBytes32(rdat, 32 * field_depth); 267 | | } 268 | | bytes32 curr = vm.load(who, slot); 269 | | 270 | | if (fdat != curr) { 271 | | require( 272 | | false, 273 | | "stdStorage find(StdStorage): Packed slot. This would cause dangerous overwriting and currently isn't supported." 274 | | ); 275 | | } 276 | | vm.store(who, slot, set); 277 | | delete self._target; 278 | | delete self._sig; 279 | | delete self._keys; 280 | | delete self._depth; 281 | | } 282 | | 283 | | function read_bytes32(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bytes32) { 284 | | return stdStorageSafe.read_bytes32(self); 285 | | } 286 | | 287 | | function read_bool(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bool) { 288 | | return stdStorageSafe.read_bool(self); 289 | | } 290 | | 291 | | function read_address(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (address) { 292 | | return stdStorageSafe.read_address(self); 293 | | } 294 | | 295 | | function read_uint(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256) { 296 | | return stdStorageSafe.read_uint(self); 297 | | } 298 | | 299 | | function read_int(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (int256) { 300 | | return stdStorageSafe.read_int(self); 301 | | } 302 | | 303 | | // Private function so needs to be copied over 304 | | function bytesToBytes32(bytes memory b, uint256 offset) private pure returns (bytes32) { 305 | | bytes32 out; 306 | | 307 | | uint256 max = b.length > 32 ? 32 : b.length; 308 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < max; i++) { 309 | | out |= bytes32(b[offset + i] & 0xFF) >> (i * 8); 310 | | } 311 | | return out; 312 | | } 313 | | 314 | | // Private function so needs to be copied over 315 | | function flatten(bytes32[] memory b) private pure returns (bytes memory) { 316 | | bytes memory result = new bytes(b.length * 32); 317 | | for (uint256 i = 0; i < b.length; i++) { 318 | | bytes32 k = b[i]; 319 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 320 | | assembly { 321 | | mstore(add(result, add(32, mul(32, i))), k) 322 | | } 323 | | } 324 | | 325 | | return result; 326 | | } 327 | | } 328 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/StdUtils.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | import "./console2.sol"; 5 | | 6 | | abstract contract StdUtils { 7 | | uint256 private constant UINT256_MAX = 8 | | 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935; 9 | | 10 | | function _bound(uint256 x, uint256 min, uint256 max) internal pure virtual returns (uint256 result) { 11 | | require(min <= max, "StdUtils bound(uint256,uint256,uint256): Max is less than min."); 12 | | 13 | | // If x is between min and max, return x directly. This is to ensure that dictionary values 14 | | // do not get shifted if the min is nonzero. More info: https://github.com/foundry-rs/forge-std/issues/188 15 | | if (x >= min && x <= max) return x; 16 | | 17 | | uint256 size = max - min + 1; 18 | | 19 | | // If the value is 0, 1, 2, 3, warp that to min, min+1, min+2, min+3. Similarly for the UINT256_MAX side. 20 | | // This helps ensure coverage of the min/max values. 21 | | if (x <= 3 && size > x) return min + x; 22 | | if (x >= UINT256_MAX - 3 && size > UINT256_MAX - x) return max - (UINT256_MAX - x); 23 | | 24 | | // Otherwise, wrap x into the range [min, max], i.e. the range is inclusive. 25 | | if (x > max) { 26 | | uint256 diff = x - max; 27 | | uint256 rem = diff % size; 28 | | if (rem == 0) return max; 29 | | result = min + rem - 1; 30 | | } else if (x < min) { 31 | | uint256 diff = min - x; 32 | | uint256 rem = diff % size; 33 | | if (rem == 0) return min; 34 | | result = max - rem + 1; 35 | | } 36 | | } 37 | | 38 | | function bound(uint256 x, uint256 min, uint256 max) internal view virtual returns (uint256 result) { 39 | | result = _bound(x, min, max); 40 | | console2.log("Bound Result", result); 41 | | } 42 | | 43 | | /// @dev Compute the address a contract will be deployed at for a given deployer address and nonce 44 | | /// @notice adapated from Solmate implementation (https://github.com/Rari-Capital/solmate/blob/main/src/utils/LibRLP.sol) 45 | | function computeCreateAddress(address deployer, uint256 nonce) internal pure virtual returns (address) { 46 | | // forgefmt: disable-start 47 | | // The integer zero is treated as an empty byte string, and as a result it only has a length prefix, 0x80, computed via 0x80 + 0. 48 | | // A one byte integer uses its own value as its length prefix, there is no additional "0x80 + length" prefix that comes before it. 49 | | if (nonce == 0x00) return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xd6), bytes1(0x94), deployer, bytes1(0x80)))); 50 | | if (nonce <= 0x7f) return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xd6), bytes1(0x94), deployer, uint8(nonce)))); 51 | | 52 | | // Nonces greater than 1 byte all follow a consistent encoding scheme, where each value is preceded by a prefix of 0x80 + length. 53 | | if (nonce <= 2**8 - 1) return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xd7), bytes1(0x94), deployer, bytes1(0x81), uint8(nonce)))); 54 | | if (nonce <= 2**16 - 1) return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xd8), bytes1(0x94), deployer, bytes1(0x82), uint16(nonce)))); 55 | | if (nonce <= 2**24 - 1) return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xd9), bytes1(0x94), deployer, bytes1(0x83), uint24(nonce)))); 56 | | // forgefmt: disable-end 57 | | 58 | | // More details about RLP encoding can be found here: https://eth.wiki/fundamentals/rlp 59 | | // 0xda = 0xc0 (short RLP prefix) + 0x16 (length of: 0x94 ++ proxy ++ 0x84 ++ nonce) 60 | | // 0x94 = 0x80 + 0x14 (0x14 = the length of an address, 20 bytes, in hex) 61 | | // 0x84 = 0x80 + 0x04 (0x04 = the bytes length of the nonce, 4 bytes, in hex) 62 | | // We assume nobody can have a nonce large enough to require more than 32 bytes. 63 | | return addressFromLast20Bytes( 64 | | keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xda), bytes1(0x94), deployer, bytes1(0x84), uint32(nonce))) 65 | | ); 66 | | } 67 | | 68 | | function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initcodeHash, address deployer) 69 | | internal 70 | | pure 71 | | virtual 72 | | returns (address) 73 | | { 74 | | return addressFromLast20Bytes(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(bytes1(0xff), deployer, salt, initcodeHash))); 75 | | } 76 | | 77 | | function bytesToUint(bytes memory b) internal pure virtual returns (uint256) { 78 | | require(b.length <= 32, "StdUtils bytesToUint(bytes): Bytes length exceeds 32."); 79 | | return abi.decode(abi.encodePacked(new bytes(32 - b.length), b), (uint256)); 80 | | } 81 | | 82 | | function addressFromLast20Bytes(bytes32 bytesValue) private pure returns (address) { 83 | | return address(uint160(uint256(bytesValue))); 84 | | } 85 | | } 86 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/Test.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | import {CommonBase} from "./Common.sol"; 5 | | import "ds-test/test.sol"; 6 | | // forgefmt: disable-next-line 7 | | import {console, console2, StdAssertions, StdCheats, stdError, stdJson, stdMath, StdStorage, stdStorage, StdUtils, Vm} from "./Components.sol"; 8 | | 9 | | abstract contract TestBase is CommonBase {} 10 | | 11 | | abstract contract Test is TestBase, DSTest, StdAssertions, StdCheats, StdUtils {} 12 | |
/Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.6.2 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2; 5 | | 6 | | // Cheatcodes are marked as view/pure/none using the following rules: 7 | | // 0. A call's observable behaviour includes its return value, logs, reverts and state writes. 8 | | // 1. If you can influence a later call's observable behaviour, you're neither `view` nor `pure` (you are modifying some state be it the EVM, interpreter, filesystem, etc), 9 | | // 2. Otherwise if you can be influenced by an earlier call, or if reading some state, you're `view`, 10 | | // 3. Otherwise you're `pure`. 11 | | 12 | | interface VmSafe { 13 | | struct Log { 14 | | bytes32[] topics; 15 | | bytes data; 16 | | address emitter; 17 | | } 18 | | 19 | | struct Rpc { 20 | | string name; 21 | | string url; 22 | | } 23 | | 24 | | // Loads a storage slot from an address (who, slot) 25 | | function load(address, bytes32) external view returns (bytes32); 26 | | // Signs data, (privateKey, digest) => (v, r, s) 27 | | function sign(uint256, bytes32) external pure returns (uint8, bytes32, bytes32); 28 | | // Gets the address for a given private key, (privateKey) => (address) 29 | | function addr(uint256) external pure returns (address); 30 | | // Gets the nonce of an account 31 | | function getNonce(address) external view returns (uint64); 32 | | // Performs a foreign function call via the terminal, (stringInputs) => (result) 33 | | function ffi(string[] calldata) external returns (bytes memory); 34 | | // Sets environment variables, (name, value) 35 | | function setEnv(string calldata, string calldata) external; 36 | | // Reads environment variables, (name) => (value) 37 | | function envBool(string calldata) external view returns (bool); 38 | | function envUint(string calldata) external view returns (uint256); 39 | | function envInt(string calldata) external view returns (int256); 40 | | function envAddress(string calldata) external view returns (address); 41 | | function envBytes32(string calldata) external view returns (bytes32); 42 | | function envString(string calldata) external view returns (string memory); 43 | | function envBytes(string calldata) external view returns (bytes memory); 44 | | // Reads environment variables as arrays, (name, delim) => (value[]) 45 | | function envBool(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (bool[] memory); 46 | | function envUint(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (uint256[] memory); 47 | | function envInt(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (int256[] memory); 48 | | function envAddress(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (address[] memory); 49 | | function envBytes32(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (bytes32[] memory); 50 | | function envString(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (string[] memory); 51 | | function envBytes(string calldata, string calldata) external view returns (bytes[] memory); 52 | | // Records all storage reads and writes 53 | | function record() external; 54 | | // Gets all accessed reads and write slot from a recording session, for a given address 55 | | function accesses(address) external returns (bytes32[] memory reads, bytes32[] memory writes); 56 | | // Gets the _creation_ bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file 57 | | function getCode(string calldata) external view returns (bytes memory); 58 | | // Gets the _deployed_ bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file 59 | | function getDeployedCode(string calldata) external view returns (bytes memory); 60 | | // Labels an address in call traces 61 | | function label(address, string calldata) external; 62 | | // Using the address that calls the test contract, has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction that can later be signed and sent onchain 63 | | function broadcast() external; 64 | | // Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the address provided as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain 65 | | function broadcast(address) external; 66 | | // Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the private key provided as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain 67 | | function broadcast(uint256) external; 68 | | // Using the address that calls the test contract, has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain 69 | | function startBroadcast() external; 70 | | // Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the address provided that can later be signed and sent onchain 71 | | function startBroadcast(address) external; 72 | | // Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the private key provided that can later be signed and sent onchain 73 | | function startBroadcast(uint256) external; 74 | | // Stops collecting onchain transactions 75 | | function stopBroadcast() external; 76 | | // Reads the entire content of file to string, (path) => (data) 77 | | function readFile(string calldata) external view returns (string memory); 78 | | // Reads the entire content of file as binary. Path is relative to the project root. (path) => (data) 79 | | function readFileBinary(string calldata) external view returns (bytes memory); 80 | | // Get the path of the current project root 81 | | function projectRoot() external view returns (string memory); 82 | | // Reads next line of file to string, (path) => (line) 83 | | function readLine(string calldata) external view returns (string memory); 84 | | // Writes data to file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does. 85 | | // (path, data) => () 86 | | function writeFile(string calldata, string calldata) external; 87 | | // Writes binary data to a file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does. 88 | | // Path is relative to the project root. (path, data) => () 89 | | function writeFileBinary(string calldata, bytes calldata) external; 90 | | // Writes line to file, creating a file if it does not exist. 91 | | // (path, data) => () 92 | | function writeLine(string calldata, string calldata) external; 93 | | // Closes file for reading, resetting the offset and allowing to read it from beginning with readLine. 94 | | // (path) => () 95 | | function closeFile(string calldata) external; 96 | | // Removes file. This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases: 97 | | // - Path points to a directory. 98 | | // - The file doesn't exist. 99 | | // - The user lacks permissions to remove the file. 100 | | // (path) => () 101 | | function removeFile(string calldata) external; 102 | | // Convert values to a string, (value) => (stringified value) 103 | | function toString(address) external pure returns (string memory); 104 | | function toString(bytes calldata) external pure returns (string memory); 105 | | function toString(bytes32) external pure returns (string memory); 106 | | function toString(bool) external pure returns (string memory); 107 | | function toString(uint256) external pure returns (string memory); 108 | | function toString(int256) external pure returns (string memory); 109 | | // Convert values from a string, (string) => (parsed value) 110 | | function parseBytes(string calldata) external pure returns (bytes memory); 111 | | function parseAddress(string calldata) external pure returns (address); 112 | | function parseUint(string calldata) external pure returns (uint256); 113 | | function parseInt(string calldata) external pure returns (int256); 114 | | function parseBytes32(string calldata) external pure returns (bytes32); 115 | | function parseBool(string calldata) external pure returns (bool); 116 | | // Record all the transaction logs 117 | | function recordLogs() external; 118 | | // Gets all the recorded logs, () => (logs) 119 | | function getRecordedLogs() external returns (Log[] memory); 120 | | // Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path) at the derivation path m/44'/60'/0'/0/{index} 121 | | function deriveKey(string calldata, uint32) external pure returns (uint256); 122 | | // Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path) at the derivation path {path}{index} 123 | | function deriveKey(string calldata, string calldata, uint32) external pure returns (uint256); 124 | | // Adds a private key to the local forge wallet and returns the address 125 | | function rememberKey(uint256) external returns (address); 126 | | // 127 | | // parseJson 128 | | // 129 | | // ---- 130 | | // In case the returned value is a JSON object, it's encoded as a ABI-encoded tuple. As JSON objects 131 | | // don't have the notion of ordered, but tuples do, they JSON object is encoded with it's fields ordered in 132 | | // ALPHABETICAL ordser. That means that in order to succesfully decode the tuple, we need to define a tuple that 133 | | // encodes the fields in the same order, which is alphabetical. In the case of Solidity structs, they are encoded 134 | | // as tuples, with the attributes in the order in which they are defined. 135 | | // For example: json = { 'a': 1, 'b': 0xa4tb......3xs} 136 | | // a: uint256 137 | | // b: address 138 | | // To decode that json, we need to define a struct or a tuple as follows: 139 | | // struct json = { uint256 a; address b; } 140 | | // If we defined a json struct with the opposite order, meaning placing the address b first, it would try to 141 | | // decode the tuple in that order, and thus fail. 142 | | // ---- 143 | | // Given a string of JSON, return it as ABI-encoded, (stringified json, key) => (ABI-encoded data) 144 | | function parseJson(string calldata, string calldata) external pure returns (bytes memory); 145 | | function parseJson(string calldata) external pure returns (bytes memory); 146 | | // 147 | | // writeJson 148 | | // 149 | | // ---- 150 | | // Let's assume we want to write the following JSON to a file: 151 | | // 152 | | // { "boolean": true, "number": 342, "object": { "title": "finally json serialization" } } 153 | | // 154 | | // ``` 155 | | // string memory json1 = "some key"; 156 | | // vm.serializeBool(json1, "boolean", true); 157 | | // vm.serializeBool(json1, "number", uint256(342)); 158 | | // json2 = "some other key"; 159 | | // string memory output = vm.serializeString(json2, "title", "finally json serialization"); 160 | | // string memory finalJson = vm.serialize(json1, "object", output); 161 | | // vm.writeJson(finalJson, "./output/example.json"); 162 | | // ``` 163 | | // The critical insight is that every invocation of serialization will return the stringified version of the JSON 164 | | // up to that point. That means we can construct arbitrary JSON objects and then use the return stringified version 165 | | // to serialize them as values to another JSON object. 166 | | // 167 | | // json1 and json2 are simply keys used by the backend to keep track of the objects. So vm.serializeJson(json1,..) 168 | | // will find the object in-memory that is keyed by "some key". // writeJson 169 | | // ---- 170 | | // Serialize a key and value to a JSON object stored in-memory that can be latery written to a file 171 | | // It returns the stringified version of the specific JSON file up to that moment. 172 | | // (object_key, value_key, value) => (stringified JSON) 173 | | function serializeBool(string calldata, string calldata, bool) external returns (string memory); 174 | | function serializeUint(string calldata, string calldata, uint256) external returns (string memory); 175 | | function serializeInt(string calldata, string calldata, int256) external returns (string memory); 176 | | function serializeAddress(string calldata, string calldata, address) external returns (string memory); 177 | | function serializeBytes32(string calldata, string calldata, bytes32) external returns (string memory); 178 | | function serializeString(string calldata, string calldata, string calldata) external returns (string memory); 179 | | function serializeBytes(string calldata, string calldata, bytes calldata) external returns (string memory); 187 | | function serializeBytes(string calldata, string calldata, bytes[] calldata) external returns (string memory); 188 | | // Write a serialized JSON object to a file. 195 | | // Returns the RPC url for the given alias 196 | | function rpcUrl(string calldata) external view returns (string memory); 197 | | // Returns all rpc urls and their aliases `[alias, url][]` 198 | | function rpcUrls() external view returns (string[2][] memory); 216 | | // Stores a value to an address' storage slot, (who, slot, value) 217 | | function store(address, bytes32, bytes32) external; 218 | | // Sets the nonce of an account; must be higher than the current nonce of the account 219 | | function setNonce(address, uint64) external; 220 | | // Sets the *next* call's msg.sender to be the input address 221 | | function prank(address) external; 222 | | // Sets all subsequent calls' msg.sender to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called 223 | | function startPrank(address) external; 224 | | // Sets the *next* call's msg.sender to be the input address, and the tx.origin to be the second input 225 | | function prank(address, address) external; 226 | | // Sets all subsequent calls' msg.sender to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called, and the tx.origin to be the second input 227 | | function startPrank(address, address) external; 242 | | function expectEmit(bool, bool, bool, bool, address) external; 243 | | // Mocks a call to an address, returning specified data. 244 | | // Calldata can either be strict or a partial match, e.g. if you only 245 | | // pass a Solidity selector to the expected calldata, then the entire Solidity 246 | | // function will be mocked. 247 | | function mockCall(address, bytes calldata, bytes calldata) external; 248 | | // Mocks a call to an address with a specific msg.value, returning specified data. 249 | | // Calldata match takes precedence over msg.value in case of ambiguity. 250 | | function mockCall(address, uint256, bytes calldata, bytes calldata) external; 251 | | // Clears all mocked calls 252 | | function clearMockedCalls() external; 253 | | // Expects a call to an address with the specified calldata. 254 | | // Calldata can either be a strict or a partial match 255 | | function expectCall(address, bytes calldata) external; 260 | | // Snapshot the current state of the evm. 261 | | // Returns the id of the snapshot that was created. 262 | | // To revert a snapshot use `revertTo` 263 | | function snapshot() external returns (uint256); 264 | | // Revert the state of the evm to a previous snapshot 265 | | // Takes the snapshot id to revert to. 266 | | // This deletes the snapshot and all snapshots taken after the given snapshot id. 267 | | function revertTo(uint256) external returns (bool); 268 | | // Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork 269 | | function createFork(string calldata, uint256) external returns (uint256); 270 | | // Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and the _latest_ block and returns the identifier of the fork 271 | | function createFork(string calldata) external returns (uint256); 272 | | // Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in, and replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction 273 | | function createFork(string calldata, bytes32) external returns (uint256); 274 | | // Creates _and_ also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork 275 | | function createSelectFork(string calldata, uint256) external returns (uint256); 276 | | // Creates _and_ also selects new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in, and replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction 277 | | function createSelectFork(string calldata, bytes32) external returns (uint256); 278 | | // Creates _and_ also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and the latest block and returns the identifier of the fork 279 | | function createSelectFork(string calldata) external returns (uint256); 280 | | // Takes a fork identifier created by `createFork` and sets the corresponding forked state as active. 281 | | function selectFork(uint256) external; 282 | | /// Returns the currently active fork 283 | | /// Reverts if no fork is currently active 284 | | function activeFork() external view returns (uint256); 285 | | // Updates the currently active fork to given block number 286 | | // This is similar to `roll` but for the currently active fork 287 | | function rollFork(uint256) external; 288 | | // Updates the currently active fork to given transaction 289 | | // this will `rollFork` with the number of the block the transaction was mined in and replays all transaction mined before it in the block 290 | | function rollFork(bytes32) external; 291 | | // Updates the given fork to given block number 292 | | function rollFork(uint256 forkId, uint256 blockNumber) external; 293 | | // Updates the given fork to block number of the given transaction and replays all transaction mined before it in the block 294 | | function rollFork(uint256 forkId, bytes32 transaction) external; 295 | | // Marks that the account(s) should use persistent storage across fork swaps in a multifork setup 296 | | // Meaning, changes made to the state of this account will be kept when switching forks 297 | | function makePersistent(address) external; 298 | | function makePersistent(address, address) external; 299 | | function makePersistent(address, address, address) external; 300 | | function makePersistent(address[] calldata) external; 301 | | // Revokes persistent status from the address, previously added via `makePersistent` 302 | | function revokePersistent(address) external; /Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/console.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | library console { 5 | | address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67); 6 | | 7 | | function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) private view { 8 | | uint256 payloadLength = payload.length; 9 | | address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS; 10 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 11 | | assembly { 12 | | let payloadStart := add(payload, 32) 13 | | let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0) 14 | | } 15 | | } 16 | | 17 | | function log() internal view { 18 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()")); /Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >=0.4.22 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | /// @dev The original console.sol uses `int` and `uint` for computing function selectors, but it should 5 | | /// use `int256` and `uint256`. This modified version fixes that. This version is recommended 6 | | /// over `console.sol` if you don't need compatibility with Hardhat as the logs will show up in 7 | | /// forge stack traces. If you do need compatibility with Hardhat, you must use `console.sol`. 8 | | /// Reference: https://github.com/NomicFoundation/hardhat/issues/2178 9 | | library console2 { 10 | | address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67); 11 | | 12 | | function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) private view { 13 | | uint256 payloadLength = payload.length; 14 | | address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS; 15 | | /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly 16 | | assembly { 17 | | let payloadStart := add(payload, 32) 18 | | let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0) 19 | | } 20 | | } 21 | | 22 | | function log() internal view { 23 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()")); 24 | | } 25 | | 26 | | function logInt(int256 p0) internal view { 27 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(int256)", p0)); 28 | | } 29 | | 30 | | function logUint(uint256 p0) internal view { 31 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(uint256)", p0)); /Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/node_modules/hardhat/console.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT 2 | | pragma solidity >= 0.4.22 <0.9.0; 3 | | 4 | | library console { 5 | | address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67); 6 | | 7 | | function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) private view { 8 | | uint256 payloadLength = payload.length; 9 | | address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS; 10 | | assembly { 11 | | let payloadStart := add(payload, 32) 12 | | let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0) 13 | | } 14 | | } 15 | | 16 | | function log() internal view { 17 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()")); 18 | | } 19 | | 20 | | function logInt(int256 p0) internal view { 21 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(int256)", p0)); 22 | | } 23 | | 24 | | function logUint(uint256 p0) internal view { 25 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(uint256)", p0)); 26 | | } 27 | | 28 | | function logString(string memory p0) internal view { 29 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string)", p0)); 30 | | } 31 | | 32 | | function logBool(bool p0) internal view { 33 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bool)", p0)); 34 | | } 35 | | 36 | | function logAddress(address p0) internal view { 37 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(address)", p0)); 38 | | } 39 | | 40 | | function logBytes(bytes memory p0) internal view { 41 | | _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes)", p0)); /Users/elvisskozdopolj/Documents/GitHub/audit-futureswap-jan2023/script/PairHashCode.s.sol 1 | | // SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED 2 | | pragma solidity ^0.8.13; 3 | | 4 | | import "forge-std/Script.sol"; 5 | | 6 | | import {DuoswapV2Pair} from "../contracts/duoswapV2/DuoswapV2Pair.sol"; 7 | | 8 | | contract PairHashCodeScript is Script { 9 | | function setUp() public {} 10 | | 11 | | function run() public view { 12 | | // get bytecode for DuoswapV2Pair 13 | | bytes memory bytecode = type(DuoswapV2Pair).creationCode; 14 | | bytes32 hash = keccak256(bytes(bytecode)); 15 | | 16 | | console2.logBytes32(hash); 17 | | } 18 | | } 19 | | 20 | | // forge script script/PairHashCode.s.sol:PairHashCodeScript 21 | |

52 | | 53 | | function setUp() public { 54 | | mainnetFork = vm.createFork(MAINNET_RPC_URL); 55 | | vm.selectFork(mainnetFork); 56 | | token0 = new TestERC20("token0", "t0", 18); 57 | | token1 = new TestERC20("token1", "t1", 18); 116 | | } 117 | | 118 | | function testAddLiquidity(uint96 _amount0, uint96 _amount1) public { 119 | | uint256 amount0 = uint256(_amount0) + 1e18; 120 | | uint256 amount1 = uint256(_amount1) + 1e18; 121 | | 122 | | userSafe = DSafeProxy(payable(IDOSConfig(address(dos)).createDSafe())); 123 | | 124 | | _depositTokens(amount0 * 100, amount1 * 100); 125 | | 126 | | pair = _createPair(address(token0), address(token1)); 127 | | pairSafe = pair.dSafe(); 128 | | 129 | | token0.mint(address(userSafe), amount0); 172 | | DSafeLogic(address(userSafe)).executeBatch(calls); 173 | | } 174 | | 175 | | function testDepositTokens() public { 176 | | // mint tokens 177 | | token0.mint(address(this), 1e21); 178 | | token1.mint(address(this), 1e21); 246 | | 247 | | _depositTokens(1e30, 1e30); 248 | | 249 | | // mint tokens 250 | | token0.mint(address(userSafe), 1e21); 251 | | token1.mint(address(userSafe), 1e21); 252 | | 253 | | _addLiquidity(1e23, 1e23); 254 | | 255 | | address[] memory path = new address[](2); 256 | | path[0] = address(token0); 257 | | path[1] = address(token1); 258 | | uint256 swapAmount = 1e21; 259 | | 260 | | int256 userSafeBalance0Before = IDOSConfig(address(dos)).getDAccountERC20( 261 | | address(userSafe), 262 | | token0 263 | | ); 264 | | int256 userSafeBalance1Before = IDOSConfig(address(dos)).getDAccountERC20( 265 | | address(userSafe), 266 | | token1 267 | | ); 268 | | 269 | | bytes memory data = abi.encodeWithSignature( 270 | | "swapExactTokensForTokens(uint256,uint256,address[],address,uint256)", 271 | | swapAmount, 272 | | 0, 273 | | path, 274 | | address(userSafe), 275 | | block.timestamp 276 | | ); 282 | | 283 | | bytes memory callData = abi.encodeWithSignature( 284 | | "approveAndCall((address,uint256)[],address,bytes)", 285 | | approvals, 286 | | address(router), 287 | | data 288 | | ); 289 | | Call[] memory calls = new Call[](1); 290 | | calls[0] = (Call({to: address(dos), callData: callData, value: 0})); 291 | | 292 | | DSafeLogic(address(userSafe)).executeBatch(calls); 293 | | 294 | | int256 userSafeBalance0After = IDOSConfig(address(dos)).getDAccountERC20( 295 | | address(userSafe), 296 | | IERC20(token0) 297 | | ); 298 | | int256 userSafeBalance1After = IDOSConfig(address(dos)).getDAccountERC20( 299 | | address(userSafe), 300 | | IERC20(token1) 301 | | ); 302 | | 303 | | int256 userSafeBalance0Diff = userSafeBalance0After - userSafeBalance0Before; 304 | | int256 userSafeBalance1Diff = userSafeBalance1After - userSafeBalance1Before; 305 | | 306 | | assertEq(userSafeBalance0After, userSafeBalance0Before - int256(swapAmount)); 307 | | assert(userSafeBalance1After > userSafeBalance1Before); 308 | | assert(userSafeBalance1Diff > 0); 309 | | assert(userSafeBalance0Diff < 0); 310 | | } 311 | | 312 | | function _addLiquidity(uint256 _amount0, uint256 _amount1) public { 313 | | pair = _createPair(address(token0), address(token1)); 335 | | approvals[1] = ( 336 | | IDOSCore.Approval({ercContract: address(token1), amountOrTokenId: _amount1}) 337 | | ); 338 | | 339 | | Call[] memory calls = new Call[](1); 340 | | 341 | | calls[0] = ( 342 | | Call({ 343 | | to: address(dos), 344 | | callData: abi.encodeWithSignature( 345 | | "approveAndCall((address,uint256)[],address,bytes)", 346 | | approvals, 347 | | address(router), 348 | | callData 349 | | ), 350 | | value: 0 351 | | }) 352 | | ); 409 | | 410 | | DSafeLogic(address(userSafe)).executeBatch(calls); 411 | | } 412 | | 413 | | function _createPair(address _token0, address _token1) public returns (DuoswapV2Pair _pair) { 414 | | _pair = DuoswapV2Pair(factory.createPair(_token0, _token1)); 415 | | pairOracle = new UniV2Oracle(address(dos), address(_pair), address(this)); 416 | | pairOracle.setERC20ValueOracle(address(token0), address(token0Oracle)); 417 | | pairOracle.setERC20ValueOracle(address(token1), address(token1Oracle)); 418 | | IDOSConfig(address(dos)).addERC20Info( 419 | | address(_pair), 420 | | "uni-v2", 421 | | "t0-t1", 422 | | 18, 423 | | address(pairOracle), 424 | | 9e17, 425 | | 9e17, 426 | | 0, 427 | | 0 428 | | ); 429 | | return _pair; 430 | | } 431 | | } 432 | | 433 | | contract DuoswapV2ConstructorTest is Test { 434 | | address public oracleAddress = 0x8fFfFfd4AfB6115b954Bd326cbe7B4BA576818f6; 435 | | 436 | | function testBaseDecimalsValidation(uint8 baseDecimals) public { 437 | | vm.assume(baseDecimals < 3 || 18 < baseDecimals); 438 | | 439 | | address owner = address(this); 440 | | string memory reason = string.concat( 441 | | "Invalid baseDecimals: must be within [3, 18] range while provided is ", 442 | | Strings.toString(baseDecimals) 443 | | ); 444 | | vm.expectRevert(bytes(reason)); 445 | | new ERC20ChainlinkValueOracle(address(oracleAddress), baseDecimals, 18, 0, 0, owner); 446 | | } 447 | | 448 | | function testTokenDecimalsValidation(uint8 tokenDecimals) public { 449 | | vm.assume(tokenDecimals < 3 || 18 < tokenDecimals); 450 | | 451 | | address owner = address(this); 452 | | string memory reason = string.concat( 453 | | "Invalid tokenDecimals: must be within [3, 18] range while provided is ", 454 | | Strings.toString(tokenDecimals) 455 | | ); 456 | | vm.expectRevert(bytes(reason)); 457 | | new ERC20ChainlinkValueOracle(address(oracleAddress), 18, tokenDecimals, 0, 0, owner); 458 | | } 459 | | } 460 | |
